My concerns are that it's dealing with my milk ducts and the area is very sore. My worry is DCIS. Hopefully this will not be the case. I appreciate all the info, it does make me feel better!
Posts.Title: Wondering if I'm alone on this journey? Nona32 NorthwindsGS

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2014 02:36PM Nona32 wrote: Thanks everyone! I don't know my Birad number and honestly until this site didn't even know what that was. But I'm in the process of getting my mammogram report so I can look at it. I do understand how when BC happens to someone in your family you are always on high alert but then when YOU are the one having a concern it all seems surreal. I just don't want to be disapointed if something bad does come of this so I'm trying to learn all I can just in case. I wasn't expecting to have to go back for this core biopsy and now that I do I'm beginning to question everything. I will keep everyone updated.....I go March 18 and they said I should have results in two days.
Posts.Title: Wondering if I'm alone on this journey? Nona32 NorthwindsGS

Posts.Content: Nona32 wrote: Hi I'm 32 years old and went to the dr last month for a lump in my breast. Long story short I have had a mammogram, ultrasound, fine needle aspiration and now I'm having to go back for a core biopsy in a couple if weeks. Everyone I talk to clinically says it's probably not going to be cancer. But I can't help but worry. My mom had breast cancer 4 years ago and is a survivor. My paternal grandmother had H. Lymphoma and died at 43 years old. So you can see why I'm concerned. My symptoms are mild just a dense lump at 3 o'clock position of my areola that is painful. Ultrasound showed complex cyst. Path from needle biopsy showed that to be a Aprocrine Cyst with atypical epithelium cells. Thus being the reason I have to go for a core biopsy. Has anyone else my age been in this same situation? How did things turn out for you?  Log in to post a reply
